reg:regulation.reg:acttitle: Balanced Budget and Ministerial Accountability Act
reg:regulation.reg:title:
Minister of State for Child Care
Expected Results for the 2022/2023
Fiscal Year Regulation

bcl:section.bcl:text: This regulation applies to the Minister of State for Child Care for the 2022/2023 fiscal year.
In this regulation, Act means the Balanced Budget and Ministerial Accountability Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Minister of State for Child Care
bcl:section.bcl:text: The expected results that the Minister of State for Child Care is to achieve for the purposes of section 5 (3) of the Act are as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: continue to implement initiatives that support government's universal child care plan that provides affordable, accessible, inclusive and high-quality care and early learning for every child whose family wants or needs it;
engage with the following to further inform implementation of universal and inclusive child care:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: Indigenous governing bodies and other entities representing Indigenous peoples;
school boards, child care providers and other sector stakeholders;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: continue to support the transfer of responsibility for child care delivery to the Ministry of Education with the goal of completing the transfer by 2023;
continue to monitor the implementation of the Multilateral Early Learning and Child Care Framework agreement with the federal government;
submit to Cabinet a report on the results referred to in paragraphs (a) through (d) on or before March 31, 2023.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Balanced Budget and Ministerial Accountability Act, S.B.C. 2001, c. 28, s. 9.]
